org.sbrubbles.genericcons

Class Types

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbrubbles.genericcons.Types

  • public final class Types
extends Object
    A namespace for general type utilities, such as cons extraction and type checking. This class is not intended to be instantiated or inherited from.
    Author:
    Humberto Anjos
    See Also:
    C

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public static boolean check(Type type,
                            Object object)
        Checks if the object's runtime type is assignable to the given type.

        Null types match nothing, and neither will primitive types (such as int.class), since Java's autoboxing will convert object to the equivalent reference type (such as Integer).

        Parameters:
        type - a type.
        object - an object.
        Returns:
        if the object's runtime type is compatible with the given type.

      • check

        public static boolean check(List<? extends Type> types,
                            List<?> objects)
        Checks if the given objects are assignable to the given types, in the given order.
        Parameters:
        types - the types to check against.
        objects - the objects to check.
        Returns:
        if the given objects are compatible with the given types.

      • fromSuperclass

        public static List<? extends Type> fromSuperclass(Class<?> baseClass,
                                                  int parameterIndex)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Searches baseClass' superclass for the type indexed by parameterIndex. A cons is converted to a list of types.

        Erasure makes it tricky to capture type data. Type tokens are a way around that, but require that type captures be made from a direct subclass, which reflexively holds its superclass' generic information.

        Note that this method doesn't search the given class' hierarchy; if the types aren't found in the direct superclass, this method errors out.

        Usage: 

         // note that the instance in a is an anonymous subclass of A, not A itself!
 A<String, List<Double>> a = new A<String, List<Double>>() { /* ... */ };

 System.out.println(Types.fromSuperclass(a.getClass(), 0)); // prints "[class java.lang.String]"
 System.out.println(Types.fromSuperclass(a.getClass(), 1)); // prints "[java.util.List<java.lang.Double>]"
 System.out.println(Types.fromSuperclass(a.getClass(), 2)); // throws an exception!

        Examples:

        SuperclassIndexOutput
        Map<String, Integer>0[String]
        Map<String, Integer>1[Integer]
        Map<String, C<Number, Integer>>1[Number, Integer]
        Map<String, C<Object, C<Number, Integer>>>0[String]
        Map<String, C<Object, C<Number, Integer>>>1[Object, Number, Integer]
        Map<String, C<Object, C<Number, Integer>>>2error: IllegalArgumentException!
        Object0error: IllegalArgumentException!
        Parameters:
        baseClass - the class whose generic superclass holds the type arguments.
        parameterIndex - where in baseClass' superclass' type argument list is the desired type.
        Returns:
        a list of the types found in parameterIndex.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if baseClass is null or no type parameters were found.

      • fromCons

        public static List<? extends Type> fromCons(Type type)
        Reads the given type as a cons and returns the list of types represented therein. null returns the empty list, and a non-C type will be returned in a one-element list.

        Examples:

        InputOutput
        null[]
        String[String]
        C<String, Number>[String, Number]
        C<String, C<Number, Object>>[String, Number, Object]
        C<String, C<Number, C<Object, List<Double>>>[String, Number, Object, List<Double>]
        Parameters:
        type - a type.
        Returns:
        the list of the types represented by the given type.
